title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Providence goalie Michael DiPietro briefly replaced Joonas Korpisalo for Bruins after Korpisalo was pulled due to a concussion protocol.
DiPietro played 6:03, stopping two shots and helping maintain the lead until Korpisalo returned in the Bruins' 4-2 win.
Coach Marco Sturm praised DiPietro, who was AHL Goalie of the Year in 2024-25, for his performance during the game.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, from Manchester, N.H., was arrested for reckless second-degree murder of her infant daughter.
The baby's body was discovered in Pine Island Pond, Manchester, on March 27, 2025, referred to as 'Baby Jane Doe.'
The case remains under investigation, with a reward increased to $5,000 for information leading to a resolution.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner found black transmission fluid; recommended to drain and refill rather than flush.
A Subaru Crosstrek owner questions the cost of replacing sensors and bushings estimated at $1,600 by a dealership.
An ex-mechanic questions low antifreeze levels in a 2018 GMC Denali; advised to top off and monitor for leaks.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated Thursday due to roof stress from heavy snow.
Students and staff were bused to Hingham High School for safety and continued classes.
Hingham faced over 17 inches of snow, prompting roof assessment by specialists and an engineer.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz criticized Rafael Devers for poor defense and conditioning prior to Devers' trade to the Giants in June 2025.
Ortiz now expresses support for Devers, emphasizing respect and admiration in a podcast interview with WEEI's Rob Bradford.
Ortiz believes Devers has learned from past experiences and wishes him success with his new team, the San Francisco Giants.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A gas leak caused a Taunton explosion that destroyed a home, injuring a mother and her daughter seriously.
The explosion displaced eight residents and damaged two neighboring homes; investigation into the leak's cause is ongoing.
Community fundraisers for affected residents have raised over $33,000 for the injured family and $12,000 for others.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 NFL teams in the 2026 NFLPA report card.
Patriots' travel resources rated poorly, with the team plane described as outdated and lacking Wi-Fi and space.
A new team facility is expected to improve poor ratings in areas like weight and training rooms starting 2026.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, a Malden teacher and coach, was arraigned on charges including two counts of rape and supplying liquor to a minor.
The alleged victim, an 18-year-old in foster care with Marino, was reportedly sexually assaulted after consuming alcohol he provided.
Marino was released on $75,000 bail and is prohibited from contacting the victim or leaving Massachusetts until his April 16 hearing.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police Sergeant Joel Daoust faces assault charges after a Springfield traffic stop incident on January 3.
Daoust is charged with assault and battery, including use of pepper spray, during a stop for speeding and lane violations.
Daoust, previously disciplined in 2015 and 2017, was suspended without pay and will be arraigned April 3.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey announced Massachusetts as the first state to use ChatGPT in its executive branch.
The AI assistant rollout for nearly 40,000 employees aims to improve government efficiency but faces criticism over data security concerns.
A reader poll shows 65% opposition to the AI initiative, citing privacy risks and environmental impact as major concerns.
